p: The composition of the essential oil from one population of S. recta from Serbia [ 17] was similar to the oil from a population in Turkey [ 31] by the preponderance of 1-octen-3-ol. In contrast to the oil from one population in Greece [ 25] and to the oil from Turkey, in the oil from Serbia, linalool was present in very low percentage only. An analysis of S. recta oil from another population in Serbia revealed a different composition compared to other oils; germacrene D and E-caryophyllene were the main constituents of the essential oil, while 1-octen-3-ol was present in very low proportions, and linalool was totally absent [ 17]. The reason for these variations in the chemical composition of the essential oil was probably because there are different subspecies of S. recta, which can differ in their essential oil composition.
